note_text:
Pt: Adams, Steven || MRN: 7628761 || DOB: 12/25/1960
Date: 08/26/2025 || Location: UC San Diego Health, La Jolla, CA
Attending: Dr. Sarah Williams
Fellow: Dr. Alex Chen (PGY-5)

Indication: Part-solid nodule for tissue diagnosis
Target: 24mm nodule in LUL

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the RUL Carina (RC1), Bronchus Intermedius, Left Carina (LC2), LUL Lingula Carina (LC1), Left Mainstem, RML Carina (RC2), Carina from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PRVC	14	283	13	80	6	19

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Full registration was used. Registration error: 3.1mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apicoposterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2). Target lesion is approximately 24mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 0.7cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Eccentric. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 7 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.1mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 6 seconds was used. Total 3 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Fiducial marker (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO) was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

Transbronchial brushing was performed with protected cytology brush through the extended working channel catheter. Total 2 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology.

Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed at Apicoposterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2). Instilled 60cc of NS, suction returned with 22cc of NS. Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

ROSE Result: Lymphocytes and benign cells, adequate for evaluation

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Williams, MD

registry_entry.institution_name: UC San Diego Health, La Jolla, CA
registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: Lymphocytes and benign cells, adequate for evaluation

code_rationales.31629: Transbronchial needle aspiration of LUL nodule (7 samples via 21G needle).
code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial cryobiopsy of LUL nodule (3 specimens, 1.1mm probe, 6s freeze).
code_rationales.31627: Ion robotic navigation bronchoscopy with shape-sensing registration.
code_rationales.31654: Radial EBUS performed with eccentric view confirming lesion location.
code_rationales.31623: Protected cytology brushings of peripheral nodule.
code_rationales.31626: Fiducial marker placement for subsequent SBRT planning.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Ion robotic bronchoscopy with CBCT-guided sampling of 24mm LUL nodule. rEBUS eccentric view. ROSE: lymphocytes and benign cells.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of fiducial markers
lines.selection_reason: Highest valued primary procedure; placement of fiducial marker documented.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)

lines.selection_reason: Robotic navigation (Ion) used to reach target.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for peripheral lesion(s)

lines.selection_reason: Bundled into 31629 (TBNA) when performed on the same lesion (NCCI).
Bundled into 31629/31626 when performed on the same lesion.

per_code.summary: Kept. Fiducial placement is distinct and highest valued.
Kept. TBNA is a distinct sampling method; typically allowed with fiducials.
Dropped. TBLB/Cryobiopsy at the same site as TBNA is typically bundled by NCCI.
Dropped. Brushing at same site bundled.

global_comments: Multiple sampling modalities used on single LUL nodule. 31626 (fiducial) drives the coding, supported by 31629 (TBNA) and 31624 (BAL). 31628/31623 dropped as bundled components.

note_text:
Pt: Hill, Dorothy || MRN: 6887336 || DOB: 7/18/1964
Date: 07/20/2025 || Location: Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston, MA
Attending: LCDR John Park, MD
Fellow: LCDR Sarah Kim, MD (PGY-6)

Indication: Multiple pulmonary nodules - dominant lesion biopsy
Target: 31mm nodule in LUL

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Carina, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, LUL Lingula Carina (LC1), RML Carina (RC2) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PCV	12	331	15	80	6	24

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Partial registration was used. Registration error: 3.4mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apicoposterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2). Target lesion is approximately 31mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.7cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Concentric. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G and 23G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 4 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial brushing was performed with protected cytology brush through the extended working channel catheter. Total 2 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology.

ROSE Result: Benign respiratory epithelium and macrophages

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Park, MD

Pt: Mitchell, Daniel || MRN: 7044515 || DOB: 8/21/1975
Date: 06/14/2025 || Location: University of Michigan Hospital, Ann Arbor, MI
Attending: Dr. Robert Martinez
Fellow: Dr. James Liu (PGY-5)

Indication: Lung cancer screening detected nodule
Target: 33mm nodule in RLL

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Left Mainstem, RUL Carina (RC1), Bronchus Intermedius, LUL Lingula Carina (LC1), RML Carina (RC2), Carina, Right Mainstem, Trachea (Distal 1/3) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PRVC	11	370	16	100	6	24

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Full registration was used. Registration error: 2.4mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Anterior-Basal Segment of RLL (RB8). Target lesion is approximately 33mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.1cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Adjacent. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 23G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 7 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.7mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 5 seconds was used. Total 5 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Transbronchial brushing was performed with protected cytology brush through the extended working channel catheter. Total 2 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology.

ROSE Result: Atypical cells present, suspicious for malignancy

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Martinez, MD

Date: 11/16/2025 || Location: UCSF Medical Center, San Francisco, CA

Indication: Multiple pulmonary nodules - dominant lesion biopsy
Target: 23mm nodule in Lingula

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Partial registration was used. Registration error: 3.0mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Inferior Lingula (LB5). Target lesion is approximately 23mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.4cm away from the planned target.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 4 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.1mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 7 seconds was used. Total 5 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Fiducial marker (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO) was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

note_text:
Pt: Taylor, Donald || MRN: 4371590 || DOB: 12/6/1954
Date: 08/26/2025 || Location: Scripps Memorial Hospital, La Jolla, CA
Attending: CDR Patricia Davis, MD
Fellow: Dr. Maria Santos (PGY-6)

Indication: Solitary pulmonary nodule
Target: 9mm nodule in LLL

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Distal 1/3), LUL Lingula Carina (LC1), Bronchus Intermedius, RUL Carina (RC1) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PCV	13	298	8	80	5	17

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Full registration was used. Registration error: 2.1mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Lateral-Basal Segment of LLL (LB9). Target lesion is approximately 9mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.8cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Adjacent. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 6 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.7mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 7 seconds was used. Total 5 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Fiducial marker (0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold CIVCO) was loaded with bone wax and placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

Transbronchial brushing was performed with protected cytology brush through the extended working channel catheter. Total 2 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology.

Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed at Lateral-Basal Segment of LLL (LB9). Instilled 60cc of NS, suction returned with 23cc of NS. Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

ROSE Result: Malignant cells identified, consistent with squamous cell carcinoma

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Davis, MD

note_text:
Pt: Sanchez, Karen || MRN: 9985183 || DOB: 12/5/1974
Date: 09/08/2025 || Location: Stanford Health Care, Stanford, CA
Attending: Dr. Jennifer Lee
Fellow: LCDR Sarah Kim, MD (PGY-6)

Indication: Lung-RADS 4B nodule
Target: 30mm nodule in RLL

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the RUL Carina (RC1), Left Carina (LC2), Carina, Bronchus Intermedius, RML Carina (RC2), Left Mainstem, Right Mainstem, Trachea (Distal 1/3) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PRVC	10	371	16	100	8	19

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Full registration was used. Registration error: 1.7mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Posterior-Basal Segment of RLL (RB10). Target lesion is approximately 30mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.0cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Adjacent. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 23G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 5 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.7mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 6 seconds was used. Total 5 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

ROSE Result: Malignant cells identified, consistent with squamous cell carcinoma

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Lee, MD

registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: Malignant cells identified, consistent with squamous cell carcinoma

code_rationales.31629: Transbronchial needle aspiration of RLL nodule (5 samples via 23G needle).
code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial cryobiopsy of RLL nodule (5 specimens, 1.7mm probe, 6s freeze).
code_rationales.31627: Ion robotic navigation bronchoscopy with shape-sensing registration.
code_rationales.31654: Radial EBUS performed with adjacent view confirming lesion location.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Ion robotic bronchoscopy with CBCT-guided sampling of 30mm RLL nodule. rEBUS adjacent view. ROSE: malignant cells identified.

note_text:
Pt: Garcia, Stephanie || MRN: 5436105 || DOB: 10/4/1959
Date: 10/15/2025 || Location: Northwestern Memorial Hospital, Chicago, IL
Attending: Dr. Robert Martinez
Fellow: Dr. Maria Santos (PGY-6)

Indication: Lung-RADS 4X nodule
Target: 25mm nodule in RML

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Left Mainstem, Left Carina (LC2), Carina, Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, RUL Carina (RC1), RML Carina (RC2), LUL Lingula Carina (LC1) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
VCV	13	399	14	80	5	24

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Partial registration was used. Registration error: 2.8mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Medial Segment of RML (RB5). Target lesion is approximately 25mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.2cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Adjacent. Continuous margin noted.

Needle was advanced into the lesion. Cone Beam CT was performed: 3-D reconstructions were performed on an independent workstation. Cios Spin system was used for evaluation of nodule location. Low dose spin was performed to acquire CT imaging. This was passed on to Ion platform system for reconstruction and nodule location. The 3D images were interpreted on an independent workstation (Ion). I personally interpreted the cone beam CT and 3-D reconstruction.

Using the newly acquired nodule location, the Ion robotic system was adjusted to the new targeted location. Vision probe removed for biopsy; catheter position maintained via shape-sensing lock. Repeat imaging confirmed tool-in-lesion.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 7 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.1mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 7 seconds was used. Total 3 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed at Medial Segment of RML (RB5). Instilled 80cc of NS, suction returned with 27cc of NS. Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

ROSE Result: Atypical cells present, suspicious for malignancy

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Martinez, MD

note_text:
Pt: Moore, Stephanie || MRN: 9533561 || DOB: 10/27/1972
Date: 08/11/2025 || Location: Stanford Health Care, Stanford, CA
Attending: Dr. Christopher Brown
Fellow: Dr. Kevin Patel (PGY-5)

Indication: Solitary pulmonary nodule
Target: 25mm nodule in RML

PROCEDURE:

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

The endotracheal tube is in good position. The visualized portion of the trachea is of normal caliber. The carina is sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy are normal; there are no endobronchial lesions.

Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea (Distal 1/3), Bronchus Intermedius, RML Carina (RC2), Left Mainstem, Left Carina (LC2), RUL Carina (RC1), LUL Lingula Carina (LC1) from mucus.

CT Chest scan was placed on separate planning station to generate 3D rendering of the pathway to target. The navigational plan was reviewed and verified. This was then loaded into robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Ventilation Parameters:
Mode	RR	TV	PEEP	FiO2	Flow Rate	Pmean
PRVC	14	326	11	100	6	22

Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with Ion platform. Partial registration was used. Registration error: 2.6mm. Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Medial Segment of RML (RB5). Target lesion is approximately 25mm in diameter. Under navigational guidance the Ion robotic catheter was advanced to 1.1cm away from the planned target.

Radial EBUS was performed to confirm lesion location. rEBUS view: Adjacent. Continuous margin noted.

The robotic arm was actively locked to maintain rigidity. Vision probe was unlocked and removed from the working channel, leaving the outer catheter locked in position via shape-sensing technology.

Transbronchial needle aspiration was performed with 21G and 23G Needle through the extended working channel catheter. Total 7 samples were collected. Samples sent for Cytology and Cell block.

Transbronchial cryobiopsy was performed with 1.1mm cryoprobe via the extended working channel catheter. Freeze time of 5 seconds was used. Total 4 samples were collected. Samples sent for Pathology.

Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed at Medial Segment of RML (RB5). Instilled 40cc of NS, suction returned with 19cc of NS. Samples sent for Cell Count, Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal), and Cytology.

ROSE Result: Granulomatous inflammation

Vision probe was re-inserted to inspect the airway. No significant bleeding observed. The catheter was retracted. Final airway inspection showed no complications.

The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complications.

DISPOSITION: Recovery, then discharge if stable. CXR to rule out pneumothorax.
Follow-up: Results conference in 5-7 days.

Brown, MD

code_rationales.31629: Transbronchial needle aspiration of RML nodule (7 samples via 21G, 23G needle).
code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial cryobiopsy of RML nodule (4 specimens, 1.1mm probe, 5s freeze).
code_rationales.31627: Ion robotic navigation bronchoscopy with shape-sensing registration.
code_rationales.31654: Radial EBUS performed with adjacent view confirming lesion location.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Ion robotic bronchoscopy with sampling of 25mm RML nodule. rEBUS adjacent view. ROSE: granulomatous inflammation.
